page.title: 05LEISURE AND RECREATION
page.content: We found that most of the people we surveyed had quite a lot of spare time. Most people played sports such as squash, badminton, keep-fit, swimming and walking. They did these regularly and were mainly in a club. As these facilities are not available in Low Hesket, they are mainly done in Carlisle. There was a Playgroup, and the Church organised meetings and clubs, coach trips and disco's. The price is the same as they would pay in a town. Alot of people went to the local Public House, which is the Rose and Crown, quite regularly but some people travelled to High Hesket to the Public House there.
